item.title: C++ GetPage
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

String^ GetPage(String^ strURL)
{
	WebRequest^ myWebRequest;
	WebResponse^ myWebResponse;
	Stream^ ReceiveStream;
	Encoding^ encode;
	StreamReader^ readStream;
	String^ strResponse;

	myWebRequest = WebRequest::Create(strURL);
	myWebResponse = myWebRequest->GetResponse();
	ReceiveStream = myWebResponse->GetResponseStream();
	encode = System::Text::Encoding::GetEncoding("utf-8");
	readStream = gcnew StreamReader(ReceiveStream, encode); 
	strResponse = readStream->ReadToEnd();

	readStream->Close();
	myWebResponse->Close();
	return strResponse;
 }

That’s in managed C++, so it’s probably useless to you.

Are you sure wget or curl isn’t what you want?

Read full topic

item.title: C++ GetPage
item.dc:creator: @charmz ChArMz
item.description:
@charmz wrote:

Can someone help me convert this C# to C++ or simply walk me through making a function that will get the HTML info from any website?

C# function:

HTML Code:

[code]string GetPage(string strURL)
{
WebRequest myWebRequest WebRequest.Create(strURL);

   WebResponse myWebResponse = myWebRequest.GetResponse();

   Stream ReceiveStream = myWebResponse.GetResponseStream();

   Encoding encode = System.Text.Encoding.GetEncoding("utf-8");

   StreamReader readStream = new StreamReader(ReceiveStream, encode);

   string strResponse = readStream.ReadToEnd();

   readStream.Close();

   myWebResponse.Close();
   return strResponse;

}[/code]

Seems this is very simply in C# but no so simple in C++
Yes I have searched the internet(cURL, ect.), but nothing helped. I am new to c++

Read full topic
